javadoc:
NOTE:  ALL AnnotationHandler CLASSES MUST END IN "AnnotationHandler".  If not,
 the ClassSearcher will not find them.
 
 AnnotationHandlers provide prefix/suffix information for various datatypes
 for specific C-like languages.

methods.name: getPrefix
methods.comment: Returns the prefix for type Enum

params.name: member
params.comment: the name of the member of the Enum

methods.name: getSuffix
methods.comment: Returns the suffix for type Enum

params.name: member
params.comment: the name of the member of the Enum

methods.name: getPrefix
methods.comment: Returns the prefix for type Composite

params.name: dtc
params.comment: the name of the member of the Composite

methods.name: getSuffix
methods.comment: Returns the suffix for type Composite

params.name: dtc
params.comment: the name of the member of the Composite

methods.javadoc:
Returns the description of the specific handler
@return the description of the specific handler
methods.name: getDescription
methods.comment: Returns the description of the specific handler

return.comment: the description of the specific handler

methods.javadoc:
Returns the name of the C-like language that this handler supports
@return the name of the C-like language that this handler supports
methods.name: getLanguageName
methods.comment: Returns the name of the C-like language that this handler supports

return.comment: the name of the C-like language that this handler supports

methods.name: getFileExtensions
methods.comment:
Returns an array of known extensions for the output file type.  If no extensions are 
 preferred, the an empty array should be returned.

return.comment: an array of known extensions for the output file type.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a string description of this handler.
@return a string description of this handler
methods.name: toString
methods.comment: Returns a string description of this handler.

return.comment: a string description of this handler

name: AnnotationHandler
